com.groupA.location.world

Class UIManagerFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.groupA.location.world.UIManagerFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChangeGroupDialogFragment.ChangeGroupDialogListener, LoginDialogFragment.LoginDialogListener, LogoutDialogFragment.LogoutDialogListener, MessageDialogFragment.MessageDialogListener, RegisterDialogFragment.RegisterDialogListener

    public class UIManagerFragment
extends Fragment
implements LoginDialogFragment.LoginDialogListener, LogoutDialogFragment.LogoutDialogListener, RegisterDialogFragment.RegisterDialogListener, MessageDialogFragment.MessageDialogListener, ChangeGroupDialogFragment.ChangeGroupDialogListener
    Handles interface events (such as button clicks and so on), opens dialogs if necessary. Associated with the layout file ui_layout.xml.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  UIManagerFragment.UIListener
      Public interface for the UI to communicate with the main activity.

      • userID_UI

        public java.lang.String userID_UI
        The name of the user, as shown by the interface. If you change its value, call updateUI() afterwards to update the look of the interface.

        public UIManagerFragment()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                ViewGroup container,
                Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This function gets called when the fragment is set up by the function setUpUI() in MainActivity.java. It loads the xml layout file, set ups the handlers and listeners for the buttons, and remembers the state of the interface if the app had been paused or rotated.

      • onClick

        public void onClick(View view)
        Handles click events on the buttons by calling the corresponding functions.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)
        This gets called when the application is being paused or rotated. Saves the values of logged_in_UI (that is, if you are logged in or not) and userID_UI (that is, the user ID as shown by the UI) for recovery.

      • logPosButtonPressed

        public void logPosButtonPressed()
        If the "log position" button is pressed, just tell the main activity that it should send the position to the client.

      • openLoginDialog

        public void openLoginDialog()
        Open a login dialog, asking for name and password.

      • onLoginDialogLogin

        public void onLoginDialogLogin(java.lang.String userID,
                      java.lang.String password)
        This gets invoked by LoginDialogFragment if the user has entered an ID and a password and chose to log in. In that case, we just pass this information back to the activity.
        Specified by:
        onLoginDialogLogin in interface LoginDialogFragment.LoginDialogListener
        Parameters:
        userID - the user's ID
        password - the user's password

      • loginSucceeded

        public void loginSucceeded(java.lang.String userID,
                  java.lang.String groupID)
        The login attempt was successful: update the user interface as required.
        Parameters:
        userID - The ID of the user, to display.

      • update_UI

        public void update_UI()
        This sets the user interface in the "logged in" or "logged out" state, depending on the value of the variable logged_in_UI.

      • loginFailed

        public void loginFailed(java.lang.String userID,
               java.lang.String message)
        The login attempt failed: open the login dialog again, with the userID of the previous attempt already inserted, and display an error message.
        Parameters:
        userID - the user ID used in the failed login attempt.

      • openLogoutDialog

        public void openLogoutDialog()
        Opens a logout dialog, asking whether the user really wants to log out.

      • onAttach

        public void onAttach(Activity activity)
        This gets called when the class is instantiated. It checks that the main activity implements the interface UIListener; and if so, it stores that implementation in mListener (to be able to invoke it if necessary). Otherwise, it raises an exception.

      • onLogoutChosen

        public void onLogoutChosen()
        The user chose to log out. Send this information back to the main activity.
        Specified by:
        onLogoutChosen in interface LogoutDialogFragment.LogoutDialogListener

      • logoutSucceeded

        public void logoutSucceeded()
        The logout attempt was successful, update the user interface as required.

      • logoutFailed

        public void logoutFailed(java.lang.String message)
        The logout attempt was not successful, display an error message.
